issues.body:
When authenticated with Suite Auth, the user is only able to access models in namespaces, in which he is added as collaborator, but the user is denied access to public models of other namespaces.


issues.body: Currently attachments that have no tags are not displayed for unauthenticated users.

The dynamics on this one aren't very clear yet, but it boils down to:

- Some users only cannot save models in namespaces accessible to them on production
- This is not replicable by all users, and does not impact non-sysadmins only
- The current suspicion is that the loss of ACL information at ModeShape level after re-importing the model is causing this
- The user-namespace role associations are still there - recreating them for impacted users does not make any difference
- Successive actions after attempting to save a model (e.g. reloading it) also produce errors, likely as a by-product
- First action will be to enrich the server-side logging in the impacted controller and service, and ask specific users impacted to replicate in order to gather additional information

issues.body:
While testing around changes for #2305 in the dev server, I bumped into an unexpected error, that has never been handled with attachments. 

It boils down to:

1. Upload a large image (size >= 4194304 bytes, which is the max_allowed_packet  setting in dev)
2. The back-end fails with an unrecoverable exception
3. The front-end gets a HTML error page with a generic error instead of JSON, which fails the REST request, and even the handling of the error response (not JSON)
4. The error message in the template is shown, but not populated due to lack of properly formatted data

I see two possible alternative solutions for this:

1. Validate the size of the attachment in the UI with a static threshold - weak, but simple
2. Validate the same but in the controller, by comparing the size of the attachment with the DB property (need more investigation to see if property easily retrievable programmatically) - much better in theory, because if that value ever changes (or in privately hosted vorto repositories), so does the validation
issues.title: Uploading large images fails without producing a human-readable error to the end user

issues.body:
### Replication scenario

1. Open the "manage" section and edit collaborators on a namespace
2. Add a collaborator and type 4+ characters that are contained within an existing *unique* user name
3. The search will auto-complete instead of displaying a drop-down menu
4. The auto-complete keeps on completing the text even after editing, which will drive any end user insane

### Possible solutions

Either:

1. Disable the auto-complete once edited / reactivate only if the whole text has been cleared, or multiple choices are present (hard and still "smelly")
2. Remove the auto-complete in favor of re-using the drop-down even with single search entries found (simple and more coherent)

Will try with choice #2 first as it seems like the faster and most efficient option.

As a consequence of this bug, all models that reference the renamed model will show errors, due to the unresolved reference. 

As a workaround a new model can be created and all references can be updated to the new model.

- a fix for the rename function, so it works as expected #2263
- a fix / cleanup mechanism that makes the renamed models accessible again #2262

issues.title: Unable to run ElasticSearch integration tests in parallel
issues.body:
This issue relates to a few issues already created, namely #2217 and #2224 - none of which solved the original problem so far. 

#2217 was about randomizing ports to avoid collisions between parallel builds when running Allegro+ES but it was not sufficient to prevent issues that ultimately failed the tests (e.g. later issues were about Allegro "unable" to access the /tmp folders it requires for temp data, broadly speaking). 

#2224 tackled the problem at Jenkins level, by attempting to throttle concurrent builds. Aside from the fact that it doesn't seem to work at least when builds are (re-)started manually, it seems a bit overkill to limit our build concurrency just for some integration tests to work. 

The current situation leaves 3 options open (in order of priority to investigate):

1. Investigate the Allegro framework to see if we didn't miss out an existing option to allow running it concurrently
2. If not, either consider getting rid of Allegro altogether and spinning a Docker container with ES directly (port randomization would then be very relevant)
3. Or, investigate the Allegro source itself and find a way to allow concurrent runs - then propose it in the project and use a fork in the meantime

Will start with n. 1 shortly.

This is a residual bug that was not one before the refactory of the search functionality planned for 0.13 (see #1833 and #2046). 
Prior to the new search, models were searchable by type without a tag. 

This has been removed in the new search to avoid confusion between type and name, i.e. only name can be searched untagged. 

However, I omitted the part of the Javascript controller that handles the types drop-down: it needs to prepend the "type:" tag to the search expression sent to the back-end. 

Otherwise, the type search would be interpreted as a name search, and since the untagged name search also covers the description, it would always yield all models for that type. 

The fix is trivial and just consists in pre-pending the type tag when using anything but "all types" in the relevant dropdown.
issues.title: Bug: the angular controller for search does not tag model types

issues.title: bug: concurrent running of ElasticSearch tests may produce interferences due to same ports in use
issues.body:
This is a speculative resolution for a problem we have noticed only recently. 

One (or more) of the integration tests for ElasticSearch was failing to reindex a model when during the build on the Jenkins side, showing a socket timeout exception. 

Given how those tests work (an ES runtime is launched by Allegro on specific ports), I suspect that multiple concurrent builds testing the ES integration tests at the same time might actually be stepping on each others' feet, when the build processes are not isolated. 

I will try and randomize the ports used to spin the service with the following rules:

* must be 4 digit ports
* must not be the production ES ports, or other obvious entries

Hopefully this will limit the collisions well enough for the use case.

issues.title: OpenAPI Generator - entities are generating duplicated mapping keys
issues.body:
When generating OpenAPI documents, in some documents the following error appears:
Parser error - duplicated mapping key

This error only appears in connection with an entity object inside of a .type model. Because the OpenAPI Generator Template function, which parses entities did not changed from current release (0.12.4) to development branch, the cause of that error must be somewhere else (in 0.12.4 this error does not appear).

This function:
https://github.com/eclipse/vorto/blob/2657685397bcf9a0f361843d8508fffcead3eef2/generators/generator-openapi/src/main/java/org/eclipse/vorto/codegen/openapi/templates/OpenAPITemplate.xtend#L615

generates this error in the development branch:
```
    Incident:
      type: object
      properties:
        incidentType:
          $ref: '#/components/schemas/IncidentType'
        roomId:
          type: string
        timeOfIncident:
          $ref: '#/components/schemas/DateTime'
~~~ Parser error - duplicated mapping key
        incidentType:
          $ref: '#/components/schemas/IncidentType'
        roomId:
          type: string
        timeOfIncident:
          $ref: '#/components/schemas/DateTime'
```

The following OpenAPI documents are containing the duplicated keys. If you compare them with each other, there are also slightly different in the block order. Documents which are generated correctly, always have the same order. But I am not sure if this was by coincident.

[OpenAPIgeneratedWithDuplicatedKeys.zip](https://github.com/eclipse/vorto/files/3951189/OpenAPIgeneratedWithDuplicatedKeys.zip)

Steps taken (during local development):
- Run the Generator Runner Spring Boot application locally
- Run the Vorto Repository locally , whereby its plugins configuration points to the local Generator Runner
- Open any Information model which you want to generate code for
- Click on Eclipse Hono Generator (right handsome) which opens the Generator Configuration popup
Expected: Popup displays 3 radio buttons with a selection of either Arduino, Java or python.
Actual: Popup does not display any selection. 


Some background info is required to work on this task. Each Code Generator provides meta information about  parameters that the generator can process. For example, the Eclipse Hono generator has a language parameter with a choice of values, namely Arduino, java, python. 
At runtime, the Vorto Repository requests the generator meta information and creates a default UI Configuration html snippet that it sends back to the Angular Controller to render. 

**Problem Analysis (so far)**
- The Generator Runner project does not process the code generator meta information for parameters at all and therefore does not create any UI that it sends back to the client.

When generating code for a very simple functionblock including the `multiple` keyword, the resulting code does not include an array but an object.

**Steps to reproduce:**
* Create a new function block at https://vorto.eclipse.org/
```
vortolang 1.0
namespace vorto.private.myfirstnamespace
version 1.0.0
displayname "MyFirstFunctionBlock"
description "Functionblock for MyFirstFunctionBlock"

functionblock MyFirstFunctionBlock {
  status {
    multiple values as double
  }
}
```
* Use the schema generators.

**Expected result:**
According to [the Vortolang specification](https://github.com/eclipse/vorto/blob/development/docs/vortolang-1.0.md#model-property)

multiple | optional | Indicates if the property is an array type
-- | -- | --

I am expecting an attribute `values` of type array to be created.

**Actual result:**
The `multiple` keyword is ignored and an object of type `number` instead of an array is generated.

JSON Schema:
```
"values": {
  "type": "number"
}
```
Ditto:
```
"values": {
  "type": "number"
}
```
Bosch IoT Suite - Digital Twin API:
```
values:
  type: number
````
Bosch IoT Suite - Connect device with Java:
```
private double values;
```
issues.title: Code generators ignoring `multiple` keyword

issues.title: OpenAPI Generator - Missing resources
issues.body:
The resources "/things", "/things/{thingId}", "/things/{thingId}/features/{featureId}/properties" and "/things/{thingId}/features/{featureId}/properties/{propertyPath}" are missing from the generated openAPI specifications. However they are available in the original IoT Things REST API. See https://apidocs.bosch-iot-suite.com/?urls.primaryName=Bosch%20IoT%20Things%20-%20API%20v2#/.

For the purpose of completion, these resources should also be available in the generated documentation.

Details:

- /things resource should be added to the generated openAPI specifications. The return type should use the generic "Things" schema defined by IoT Things REST API.

- /things/{thingId} resource should be added. The return type should use the specific schema defined by the corresponding vorto definition. For example, for smart home controller openAPI specification, the schema should be the JSON structure of SHC thing.
- /things/{thingId}/features/{featureId}/properties resource should be added. The return type should use the specific schema for the properties. For example, for feature DeviceInfo, the DeviceInfoProperties should be used.
- /things/{thingId}/features/{featureId}/properties/{propertyPath} should be added. The definition for the IoT Things REST API can be used completely.

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Fixes #1960 - Collaborators model not anonymized upon account deletion (#1974)

Signed-off-by: Erle Czar Mantos <erleczar.mantos@bosch-si.com>

issues.title: BUG: Collaborators model not anonymized upon account deletion
issues.body:
As a collaborator I created a model and later deleted my account. My user-id continued to show for the model.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Sign-in
2. Ask another user to make you a collaborator of their namespace
3. Create a model in this shared namespace
4. Ask the other user to remove your user from the namespace
5. Delete your account

Expected: The model you created should have been anonymized
Actual: Model continues to show your user-id although it has already been deleted

I've written a ditto skeleton generator plugin template. It's build with the Plugin API v2 using Vorto 0.11.3-nightly. In my models I have a generic base fbmodel with configuration and status. Several other fbmodels extend this model without adding new fields to config or status. Having 7 functionblocks defined in an infomodel, only the 7nth will be processed correctly and receive the parents properties, all others will only receive an empty properties section.

See my [vorto-ditto-skeleton-generator](https://github.com/w4tsn/vorto-ditto-skeleton-generator) project for reference how I'm using the generator as micro-service in a docker-container.

What is wrong?
---

The generator does not always traverse through the `extends` dependencies and return all of the configuration and status properties. This might be a bug or a flaw in my template.

How to reproduce
---

My used docker-compose file looks like this: 
[docker-compose.yml.txt](https://github.com/eclipse/vorto/files/3622506/docker-compose.yml.txt)

A working and verified image is [on docker hub](https://cloud.docker.com/u/lionax/repository/docker/lionax/vorto-ditto-skeleton-generator): `lionax/vorto-ditto-skeleton-generator:latest`

The vorto-variables.env looks like this:

```env
# Generell settings
GENERATOR_USER=vorto_generators
GENERATOR_PASSWORD=1234
VORTO_PORT=8080
CONTEXT_PATH=/

# Repository
DATASOURCE=mysql
AUTH_PROVIDER=github
ADMIN_USER=<your-github-user>
GITHUB_CLIENT_ID=<your-github-client-id>
GITHUB_CLIENT_SECRET=<your-github-client-secret>
PLUGINS=<base64 encoded json structure>

# Generators
VORTO_URL=http://repository:8080
3RD_PARTY_SERVICE_URL=http://generators:8080

# database
MYSQL_USER=root
MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD=<your-mysql-password>
MYSQL_DATABASE=vorto
```

Used example infomodel and fbmodels [othermo.meter_Heat_1.0.0.zip](https://github.com/eclipse/vorto/files/3622501/othermo.meter_Heat_1.0.0.zip)

[The skeleton template](https://github.com/w4tsn/vorto-ditto-skeleton-generator/blob/master/generator-eclipsedittoskeleton/src/main/java/com/othermo/vorto/plugin/dittoskeleton/templates/ThingSkeletonTemplate.xtend) can be found [in my skeleton project on github](https://github.com/w4tsn/vorto-ditto-skeleton-generator).

How should it be?
---

If the template is correct, the generator should in any case return all properties of a model and it's parents.

For a newly created Information Model, the Create Mapping button gets displayed.

A User who logs in to the Repository with his Bosch ID account and Does not own any namespace, neither is he collaborator of any other namespace, the user cannot access any public models.

issues.title: Intermittently, clicking on Save will reload a new Details page without a Save Button
issues.body:
Description:

This is an intermittent behaviour. When you click on Save, it would reload the entire Details page but sometimes, the reloaded Details page doesn't have a "Save" button and a "Add Reference" button.

How to Reproduce:

Create a model. Click on Save button. After reloading, click on Save button again. Do it until you've reproduced the problem.

Expectation:

Save Button and Add Reference button should always be there regardless (if you are logged in).

Reality:

Sometimes, the Save button and Add reference button aren't there.

-------------------
This seems only reproducible in Chrome. I wasn't able to reproduce this in Firefox yet.

issues.title: Clicking on Save Button when creating a datatype with multiple properties reformats it all to one line
issues.body:
Description:

When creating a new datatype with multiple properties, saving it would reformat it and pull all properties in one line.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a datatype (for example: Point2d)
2. Type 2 properties:

>x as float
>y as float

3. Click on Save

Expectations:

Point2d would show as 

> 
>entity Point2D {
>	x as float 
>        y as float
>}

Reality:

>entity Point2D {
>	x as float y as float
>}

Reproducible in both Chrome and Firefox

Another Observation:

This doesn't happen if I put a comment on the property. Like
> x as float "Location in X coordinate"
> y as float "Location in Y coordinate"

But saving it like this will also reformat it. It will add a space between x and y properties

>

When attempting to download a device image in the repository, Chrome gives HTTP ERROR 406 and Firefox creates an empty file (zero bytes).

Replicate:
1. login with your github account.
2.  Select "Explore" menu option.
3. Select a model, e.g. Bosch' "TDL".
4. On the page that opens, select "Attachements" ( https://vorto.eclipse.org/api/v1/attachments/com.bosch.bcx:TDL:1.0.0/files/tdl.jpg )

Outcome: 
The attachment can't be viewed or downloaded.

Expected: No message should be displayed after saving a comment, "Please enter your comment" could be shown as a tooltip on the disabled Send button.

issues.title: generator exceptions
issues.body:
Tried the following functionblock similar to the examples:

`
namespace alex
version 1.0.0
displayname "Presence"
category demo

functionblock Presence {
	status {
		mandatory objectDetected as boolean
		mandatory objectCount as dictionary
	}
	events {
	  measurement {
	    data as string
	  }
	}
	operations {
		breakable off()
	}

}
`
together with
`
vortolang 1.0
namespace alex
version 1.0.0
displayname "Camera"
category Camera
using alex.Presence; 1.0.0

infomodel Camera {
	functionblocks {
		presence as Presence
	}	
}
`

The problem is the 'dictionary' directive. (In https://github.com/eclipse/vorto/blob/development/core-bundles/docs/dsl_grammar_datatype.md it is written with a capital D, but the online editor accepts only d). Types are optional and we wan't to store arbitrary JSON in it.

When generating source code I get:
Bosch IoT Suite/Java:   java.lang.ClassCastException: org.eclipse.vorto.core.api.model.datatype.impl.DictionaryPropertyTypeImpl cannot be cast to org.eclipse.vorto.core.api.model.datatype.PrimitivePropertyType
Bosch IoT Suite/Arduino: java.lang.NullPointerException
Bosch IoT Suite/Python: java.lang.ClassCastException: org.eclipse.vorto.core.api.model.datatype.impl.DictionaryPropertyTypeImpl cannot be cast to org.eclipse.vorto.core.api.model.datatype.ObjectPropertyType
Eclipse Ditto: java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: -1
Google ProtoBuf: java.lang.NullPointerException
JavaBean: does not generate the objectCount property
`	/**
	* Setter for objectCount.
	*/
	/**
	* Getter for objectCount.
	*/
	`
I didn't try the other generators.

issues.body:
#### As of now, the generated code for the three technologies is not working. Adjust the generated code in order to allow the ids to match the "new" Bosch IoT setup.

| Name | New Name (ID) | Value | Note |
|---------|---------------------|---------|-------|
|hono_tenant|tenantId|[a-z0-9]*_hub|-|
|hono_password|device_password|*|-|
|hono_endpoint|hub_adapter_host|*.bosch-iot-suite.com| Default to mqtt|
|hono_deviceId|deviceId|<some_namespace>:[0-9]*|-|
|hono_clientId|clientId|<some_namespace>:[0-9]*| Default to deviceId (do we need this at all? Always deviceId)|
|hono_authId|authId|<some_namespace>_[0-9]*| New variable replacing the current authId|
|hono_certificatePath|certificatePath|<some_path>|-|
|ditto_topic|ditto_topic|<some_namespace>/[0-9]*|-|
|-|userId|${authId}@${tenantId}| Automatically generated|

> **Note**: 
> - deviceId uses **:** to separate namespace and id
> - authId uses **_** to separate namespace and id
> - ditto_topic uses **/** to separate namespace and id

--- 

**Additionally, for python**, please rename the `requirement.txt` file to `requirements.txt` in order to make it installable with the default `pip install -r requirements.txt` command.

Steps taken:
1) Create model A with 1 function block
2) only give read/write access of model A to other user
3) try to change model A by authorized user and hit save
Expected: Changes are saved
Actual: nothing happens.
issues.title: User cannot save shared model, if not authorized to all sub models

issues.title: Keywords as a part of the Vorto models
issues.body:
Initially, this topic has been discussed in this [issue](https://github.com/eclipse/vorto/issues/908#issuecomment-386564325).

In our model, there is a "status" property where the asynchronous operation progress is reported. It looks like:
```
...
status {
  mandatory status as FirmwareUpdateStatus
}
...
```
The issue is that "status" is a keyword and this model doesn't compile. As a workaround, we are using:
```
mandatory ^status as FirmwareUpdateStatus
```
but that's a good point for improvement.

**Steps:**
From http://vorto.eclipse.org/#/api, Choose the REST API to GET image of a vorto model, that does not have an image.
e.g. 
GET http://vorto.eclipse.org//rest/model/image/devices/TISensorTag/1.0.0
**Expected Result:**
Response Code should be 404
**Actual Result:**
Response Code is 500 - Internal Server Error

issues.title: Create and delete model with same name restores "old" definition
issues.body:
Steps to reproduce:
1) Create project
2) create info model , e.g. NewInfoModel
3) Import functionblock , e.g. Gyroscope
4) save project
5) Delete infomodel
6) Create infomodel with same name 'NewInfoModel'

Expected: model with initial content
Acutal: model containing Gyroscope functionblock

**Steps:**

1. Create a datatype e.g. 
```
entity TightenResult {
	  optional cellId as int
	  optional channelId as int 
}
```

2. Create a function block e.g. 
```
functionblock Magnetometer {
	operations {
                getval() returns TightenResult
	}
}
```
3. The function block has a validation error that the referenced model has to be imported
4. Drag and Drop the entity to the function block

**Expected Result:**
The datatype should be included in the function block. The function block should have a statement "using.." referencing the data type.

**Actual Result:**
The Functionblock's namespace, name and version becomes null.
This is related to [#622](https://github.com/eclipse/vorto/issues/622)

issues.title: Web Editor malfunctioning for set contextpath
issues.body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Define a contextpath in yml, e.g. /editor
2. Start the server

We have a code generator "IoT Gateway for Kura (with Vorto-Models)" registered with Vorto. That code generator is executed on our Virtual Developer platform when someone selects an information model on the Vorto model repository and clicks on "Generate". We use the class GeneratorServiceInfo (contained in artifact org.eclipse.vorto.codegen) from the released version 0.9.0 of Vorto to provide the generator metadata. That class does not yet include the fields "configTemplate" and "configKeys" (in 0.10.0 they _are_ included). So the actual model repository web app somehow depends on Vorto 0.10.0. For our generator a click on "Generate" causes an error in the JavaScript function "generate" in controllers.js.

As a workaround we simply have copied two source code files from 0.10.0 to use them to provide the JSON data. A better, more general solution might be to modify the JavaScript "generate" function to not depend on the presence of  "configTemplate" and "configKeys" in the JSON data.

Please note that at the time of writing this issue, a ready built version (e.g. SNAPSHOT) of 0.10.0 is not publicly available.
issues.title: Generation through Model Repository does not work when using GeneratorServiceInfo Class from Version 0.9.0

issues.title: Unexpected Namespace in Functionblock Wizard
issues.body:
**Action**
A new functionblock shall be created by invoking the Functionblock wizard. 

**Expected Result:**
The default namespace ends with `.fb` e.g. `com.mycompany.fb`

**Actual Result:**
The default namespace ends with `.type`, which equals to the default namespace of an entity or enum.

**Rational:**
Since a model is uniquly identified using `namespace`\+ `version` + `name`, it should be possible to create a functionblock and entity with the same name. Therefore, the default values should support this by already separating the models by namespace

issues.title: In the toolset, A code generator accepts invalid vorto models
issues.body:
A user tries to generate an invalid model
Expected: The generation process aborts and should inform the user that the model is invalid.
Actual: The generator is executed which could potentially result in a non-correct output.

Confirmations:
- Validation Service in the Vorto Core Bundle that is shared among Toolset and Repository
- When a user invokes a generator for an invalid model in the toolset using the Eclipse Toolset Generators, the console prints out validation error(s) and aborts the generation process.

Model A --> Model B --> Model A

issues.body:
1) Go to vorto.eclipse.org 
2) Choose any information model and bring up its details
3) Select the LWM2M Generator

Expected result: HTTP 500 Error
Actual result: Zip File Download containing generated artefacts

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Closes #223 - Creation of Mapping Models not possible anymore. This is just a quick fix. The entire wizard code needs a whole lot of refactoring.

Signed-off-by: Erle Czar Mantos <erleczar.mantos@bosch-si.com>

issues.title: Creation of Mapping Models not possible anymore
issues.body:
**Goal:**
_Create a mapping model for an existing Function Block Model_

**What are the steps taken**
Right-click on the existing Function Block Model -> `New Mapping Model`. The mapping model wizard appears. 

**Expected Behaviour**
After filling out all the required fields the `OK` button is enabled, and the model can be created by clicking on it

**Actual Behaviour**
The `OK` button is greyed out.

issues.title: Removing model reference does not unlink model in perspective
issues.body:
A user removes a reference in the vorto model using the vorto perspective
Expected: The model element's child model (that is deleted) disappears from the tree viewer
Actual: Child element still appears.

I observed the following weird behaviour When a model is deleted in the vorto perspective:  
the project selector showing the project does not match the content in the tree viewers.
issues.title: Delete in vorto perspective behaves strangely

issues.title: Local toolset generator's mapping context is not populated
issues.body:
1) When a generator's serviceKey, e.g. "lwm2m" matches the targetplatform of mapping(s), the mapping context is not populated. 

2) Mappings can reside anywhere in the eclipse project to be populated for generators

Here is the forum thread for details:
https://www.eclipse.org/forums/index.php?t=msg&th=1076270&goto=1729096&#msg_1729096

issues.title: vorto command line tool: "No datatype could be defined" as response to download
issues.body:
Trying to download a model using
`vorto download com.bosch.fb.sensors.Gyroscope:1.0.0`
yields "No datatype could be defined".

I haven't checked that systematically, but it seems that I can only download things created by vortouser. If it's a privileges issue, maybe the error message should be made more explicit?

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Merge pull request #349 from bsinno/bugfix/50_cli_illlegal_file_download

Illegal filenames created on OSX while download. Fixes #50

issues.title: vorto command line tool on OS X: download yields illegal file names
issues.body:
When downloading a model using e.g.
`vorto info examples.datatypes.state.DoorState:1.0.0`
two files are being created. One is an empty, illegal directory called "\"
 and the other is the model, the file name unfortunately also preceded by "\", which requires one to rename the file before it can be opened.
